info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 28 at 1:55PM EDT until July 28 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL PERRY AND NORTHWESTERN MORGAN COUNTIES... At 155 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over New Lexington, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... New Lexington, Somerset, Shawnee, Perry State Forest, Crooksville, Junction City, Corning, Hemlock, and Rendville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
